meanings.definition: The outer layer of skin on the surface of the body.
meanings.sent1: The cuticle helps protect our skin from dirt and germs.
meanings.sent2: She applied lotion to her cuticle to keep it moisturized.
meanings.sent3: The cuticle on his finger felt rough like sandpaper.
meanings.sent4: Her cuticle was like a shield, guarding her skin from harm.
meanings.sent5: The cuticle acts as a barrier, keeping the skin safe from harm.

meanings.definition: A protective layer covering the epidermis of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The cuticle on the leaf helps prevent water loss.
meanings.sent2: The plant's cuticle glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cuticle on the stem was like a raincoat for the plant.
meanings.sent4: The cuticle shielded the plant from harsh environmental conditions.
meanings.sent5: The shiny cuticle of the leaf reflected the morning dew.

meanings.definition: A layer of nonliving cells covering the hair shaft.
meanings.sent1: The cuticle of the hair can become damaged from heat styling.
meanings.sent2: She gently massaged oil into her hair cuticle for shine.
meanings.sent3: The cuticle on the hair looked like tiny fish scales.
meanings.sent4: The hair cuticle acts as a protective barrier for the strand.
meanings.sent5: The smooth cuticle of the hair made it look healthy and shiny.
